page.title: 11ST.MARY'S BUTTERFLY CENTRE
page.content: {LONGSTONE BUTTERFLY CENTRE} Up at Longstone,in a converted flower farm building,is the Butterfly Centre.This consists of a restaurant,a museum,a putting green and a butterfly area.At one time there are about 100 butterflies and 15 different types.In the summer the ideal temperature is 78',and in the winter the heaters are turned off to make it like winter for the butterflies.The butterflies are brought in from all over the world,and after being in a cacoon for two weeks they are free to flit around the place .The rarest butterfly up there is the English Swallowtail.It was Mr.Mumfords idea,and from that idea it took 18 months to complete.The machinery comes from all over Scilly.The oldest one, the sea drill,is on display with a few others.15 people are employed to run the centre.
